description: short name for the data network associated with a MacroSheds site. See "Site summary table" under the Data tab at macrosheds.org for more information.
Short name for the data domain associated with a MacroSheds site. See "Site summary table" under the Data tab at macrosheds.org for more information.
Short name for MacroSheds site. See "Site summary table" under the Data tab at macrosheds.org for more information.
watershed area
details: watershed area is calculated using the R function sf::st_area() with inputs from either watershed boundary shapefiles provided by domains or watershed shapfiles delineated by macrosheds based on latitude and longitude of stream gauges

description: mean watershed slope
details: Watershed slope is calculated based on DEM downloaded with the R package elevatr::get_elev_raster() (from Amazon Web Services and Open Topography Global Datasets API) and the watershed shapefile with the R function whitebox::wbt_slope()

description: mean watershed elevation
details: Watershed elevation is calculated based on DEM downloaded with the R package elevatr::get_elev_raster() (from Amazon Web Services and Open Topography Global Datasets API)

description: minimum watershed elevation
details: Watershed elevation is calculated based on DEM downloaded with the R package elevatr::get_elev_raster() (from Amazon Web Services and Open Topography Global Datasets API)

description: watershed soil organic matter
details: Data from gSSURGO is summarized by taking a weighted mean of the particular parameter for the full depth of the soil column for all data available in the watershed boundary. Because SSURGO has gaps in some areas, if data was not available for more than 15 percent of the watershed no data is reported for this variable. Soil organic matter definition from NRCS: amount by weight of decomposed plant and animal residue expressed as a weight percentage of the less than 2 mm soil material

description: watershed soil sand percentage
details: Data from gSSURGO is summarized by taking a weighted mean of the particular parameter for the full depth of the soil column for all data available in the watershed boundary. Because SSURGO has gaps in some areas, if data was not available for more than 15 percent of the watershed no data is reported for this variable. Soil sand definition from NRCS: Mineral particles 0.05mm to 2.0mm in equivalent diameter as a weight percentage of the less than 2 mm fraction

description: watershed soil silt precent
details: Data from gSSURGO is summarized by taking a weighted mean of the particular parameter for the full depth of the soil column for all data available in the watershed boundary. Because SSURGO has gaps in some areas, if data was not available for more than 15 percent of the watershed no data is reported for this variable. Soil silt definition from NRCS: Mineral particles 0.002 to 0.05mm in equivalent diameter as a weight percentage of the less than 2.0mm fraction.

description: watershed soil clay percent
details: Data from gSSURGO is summarized by taking a weighted mean of the particular parameter for the full depth of the soil column for all data available in the watershed boundary. Because SSURGO has gaps in some areas, if data was not available for more than 15 percent of the watershed no data is reported for this variable. Soil clay definition from NRCS: Mineral particles less than 0.002mm in equivalent diameter as a weight percentage of the less than 2.0mm fraction

description: watershed mean soil pH
details:
Data from gSSURGO is summarized by taking a weighted mean of the particular parameter for the full depth of the soil column for all data available in the watershed boundary. Because SSURGO has gaps in some areas, if data was not available for more than 15 percent of the watershed no data is reported for this variable. Soil pH definition from NRCS: The negative logarithm to the base 10, of the hydrogen ion activity in the soil using the 1:1 soil-water ratio method. A numerical expression
of the relative acidity or alkalinity of a soil sample
